name: places/ChIJLfH603RZwokRHpHvNXP4e8E

plusCode.compoundCode: P2VC+C6 Manhattan, New York, NY, USA

adrFormatAddress: 447 3rd Ave, Manhattan, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: DO NOT bring your pet here! I brought my dog in for her vaccinations and a dental cleaning consultation. They told me her teeth had a build up of plaque and tartar. I will be the first to admit I do not know how to read a medical chart and cannot understand some of the medical jargon. What I would expect from any decent practice or professional is that they would outline EVERYTHING abnormal with your pet. After over a year, I was informed (by a different practice) her chart states she bas TWO teeth fractures that I was never told about. This sounds pretty serious and even if it is a mundane diagnosis, chalking up her dental issues to plaque and tartar is disingenuous. This is just the highest level of unprofessionalism I experienced here, and I won’t even get into the cold attitude by some of the staff. PLEASE go somewhere else as this is a money hungry business with exceptional turnover as I have heard.

originalText.text:
After a physical, Bond Vet said that my cat's teeth needed to be removed. They couldn't see him for a month. When we asked whether we needed to find another vet who could see him immediately, they reassured us it wasn't urgent. When we finally got him into surgery, they said his teeth were in terrible shape, they had to remove multiple teeth, and the situation was urgent. I don't know how many teeth he would have if I had found another vet.

Bond Vet diagnosed my other cat with asthma and prescribed medication. The first few times we refilled his medication, it took multiple calls to Bond Vet to get them to confirm the prescription. This latest time, I called them weeks in advance. They wouldn't call in the prescription, but they said that they would confirm it when the pharmacy reached out.

Three weeks later, the prescription still hadn't been filled. The pharmacy said Bond Vet had denied it. I called them. They had erased my name from their system. They reassured me that they would fill the prescription immediately.

Then, they called me back to say that I would need to see the vet first. My cat would go without an emergency medicine for several more days.

I found a new vet.

originalText.text:
One terrible experience after another.

Got charged about $300 for the Vet to send my dogs urine out for testing. It took 6 days to hear back, with the response, "we can confirm there is an infection but need a different sample to understand what type."

We requested meds on the spot or my dog would have been peeing blood for 6 days.

Will be looking for a new Vet in Murray Hill/Kips Bay.

originalText.text: My 4th time back to Bond Vet and I have to admit, I never leave reviews unless they are bad. In this case, it’s quite opposite. First, the staff: from the phone call, to the front desk to the vet techs and the vets are just wonderful. While examining my dogs they were vocal and let me know exactly what they were doing and hearing/seeing throughout. Before they take my dogs back for testing, they show you the cost of each test, explain the reason for them and then give you the option to move forward with the plan or not. In some cases I have had to hold off because I’m a single income person with 3 senior pets, just barely living paycheck to paycheck. We ultimately decide what’s most important at the moment and they really do work with you on how to maximize care while limiting costs. By no means are they cheap, but they are thorough and very caring. It’s tough, I understand pet care is expensive, but so far I have only had the best experience with everyone at this location. Not to mention, it’s the cleanest and chicest vet I’ve ever been to.

originalText.text: Unprofessional and less than helpful. This practice will not follow up with you about your pet — and they will charge you abnormal prices for their services. If you are considering Bond Vet, I suggest you keep looking.
